title: Sony Xperia XZ3 vs XZ2: 5 changes you need to know about

## **Sony Xperia XZ3 vs XZ2: 5 changes you need to know about**

At [IFA 2018](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/ifa-2018-3497586), Sony has
just unveiled its latest flagship smartphone. The [Sony Xperia
XZ3](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/sony-xperia-xz3) comes a mere six
months after the XZ2 and might be a bit of a blow to those who have recently
invested in the device.

While the launch of a flagship so soon might not be welcomed by all, the fast
turnaround does mean that Sony can quickly address any issues and offer new
features without having to wait for a further six months to do so.

The Xperia XZ2 was a step in the right direction for Sony Mobile, but the XZ3
takes things even further. Could this be Sony’s best phone yet?

## **1\. Display – OLED or LCD**

Arguably the biggest upgrade with the XZ3 is the display. Sony has ditched LCD
and instead taken inspiration from its
[A1](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/sony-a1-oled) television line,
opting for OLED instead.

**Related:[Best smartphones](https://www.trustedreviews.com/best/best-
smartphone-3431175)**

![](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

This is the same display tech seen in handsets such as the [Samsung Galaxy
S9](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/samsung-galaxy-s9) and [iPhone
X](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/iphone-x), and it gives better
contrast, brighter colours and more immersive blacks. Even after only a couple
of hours with the XZ3, the improvements were obvious.

The display resolution has been boosted too, now sitting at quad-HD+ rather
than FHD+. HDR support remains, as does the 18:9 aspect ratio and a distinct
lack of notch.

## **2\. The design is a big improvement**

The components required for an OLED panel are thinner than those needed for
LCD, which means you can produce a slimmer phone as a result. And that’s
exactly what Sony has done.

The XZ3 is notably better-looking than the XZ2, thanks to a curvier body and a
rugged aluminium rim holding the Gorillas Glass 5 in place.

One issue that remains is the poor positioning of the fingerprint sensor. It’s
far too close to the middle of the rear and is difficult to hit accurately.

![](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

## **3\. Not much has changed in the camera, apart from the UI**

Like the [Sony Xperia XZ2](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/sony-xperia-
xz2), the XZ3 boasts a Sony-made 19-megapixel sensor with an f/2.0 aperture
and the ability to properly record 4K HDR video. Sony reps did say the
underlying software has been improved since the XZ2’s release, so there’s a
chance you might see better pictures.

The real updates have come in the camera interface, which is a lot cleaner and
easier to navigate than before. No longer are the various modes buried beneath
multiple menus, instead easily available with a swipe.

## **4\. Android Pie is here at launch**

When it launches in October, the Sony Xperia XZ3 will be one of the first
phones to come running the latest version of Android.

[Android 9 Pie](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/android-pie) brings in
new Digital Wellness features, an updated look and lots more features.

**Related:[When will my phone get Android
Pie?](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/android-pie-9-phones-3535543)**

![](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

One feature missing is the updated navigation keys and the new multitasking
view. Instead, you get the traditional Android back, home and overview keys,
and the Rolodex-style multi-tasking menu.

Sony has also added a few new software features of its own. You can quickly
raise the phone to engage the camera, or tap the sides of the screen to bring
up a quick app launcher.

## **5\. A bigger battery, but no likely performance boosts**

Internally, there’s very little to differentiate the XZ3 and XZ2. Both are
powered by a Snapdragon 845, have 4GB of RAM and 64GB of expandable storage.
More RAM would have been nice, but 4GB will likely get the job done.

![](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

One upgrade is the battery size, which is now 3330mAh as opposed to 3180mAh.
Pair that larger cell with the more efficient screen and there’s hope this
phone could last longer between charges.
